result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devante Faye Seamster

records.addlTxt: Defense requested plea hearing adjournment; waiting for defendant's other case 22CF2787 to go through preliminary hearing. Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 36. Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Devante Faye Seamster.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court in person for Devante Faye Seamster.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #22CF2787.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Dilliman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster not in court, in custody. Abby Rokendorf appeared in person, in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Sargent failed to appear due to being on vacation this week. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Devante Faye Seamster in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devante Faye Seamster appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
